title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing othersâ€™ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement inab.bioinformatics@lists.certh.gr. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozillaâ€™s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to Odyssey
text: Hi ! Many thanks taking interest improving Odyssey. document outlines propose changes Odyssey.

what: Getting familiar with Git and GitHub
title: Contributing to Odyssey
text: Git? Git version control system tracks changes files time, allowing multiple people collaborate project safely. GitHub? GitHub online platform hosting Git repositories collaborating others pull requests, issues, discussions. Essential Concepts - Repository (repo): projectâ€™s folder GitHub. - Fork: copy repository, can make changes freely. - Branch: workspace changes (avoid working directly main). - Commit: saved change message describing . - Pull Request (PR): request merge changes main project. Create GitHub account donâ€™t already one. Install Git computer. Configure Git information (terminal, powershell, etc.):
code: git config --global user.name  "Your Name" git config --global user.email "your.email@example.com"

title: Contributing to Odyssey
text: encounter bug app, please open issue using Bug Report template. new feature suggestions (.e., suggestions improving app, ??), use Feature Request template. matters, feel free open issue using Blank template. issue created, can assign reviewer leave unassigned â€” team member review take .

title: Contributing to Odyssey
text: â€™d like write code Odyssey, standard workflow follows: Check isnâ€™t already issue idea Odyssey issues avoid duplicating work. isnâ€™t one already, please create one others know â€™re working . Fork Odyssey dev branch GitHub account Clone fork repository Create new branch changes (relevant issue?) Make necessary changes / additions within forked repository. Submit Pull Request dev branch wait code reviewed merged.

title: Contributing to Odyssey
text: within project folder, install development dependencies: Ensure everything builds passes checks cleanly Implement changes, run make sure everything builds passes checks cleanly ready commit push changes

title: Contributing to Odyssey
text: project follows modular Shiny structure: feature self-contained module UI, server logic, inputs/outputs, tests. Modules make app easier understand, test, extend without breaking unrelated parts.

title: Contributing to Odyssey
code: â”œâ”€ R/ â”‚  â”œâ”€ app_ui.R               # top-level UI (calls module UIs) â”‚  â”œâ”€ app_server.R           # top-level server (calls module servers) â”‚  â”œâ”€ mod_<feature>.R        # one file per module (UI + server) â”‚  â”œâ”€ utils-*.R              # shared helpers (pure functions) â”‚  â””â”€ globals.R              # (optional) constants â”œâ”€ inst/ â”‚  â”œâ”€ app/www/               # CSS/JS/images â”‚  â””â”€ templates/             # (optional) downloads, reports â”œâ”€ tests/ â”‚  â”œâ”€ testthat/              # unit tests & shinytests â”‚  â””â”€ testthat.R â”œâ”€ DESCRIPTION               # package metadata & deps â”œâ”€ NAMESPACE                 # generated by roxygen2 â”œâ”€ NEWS.md                   # changelog (user-facing) â””â”€ README.md

title: Contributing to Odyssey
text: module file exports two functions Use NS(id) namespacing input/output IDs. Keep business logic pure helper functions R/utils-*.R â€™re testable. Return reactives modules truly need (avoid global state).
code: # R/mod_example.R #' example UI example_ui <- function(id) {   ns <- NS(id)   tagList(     sidebarLayout(       sidebarPanel(         textInput(ns("name"), "Your name"),         actionButton(ns("go"), "Greet")       ),       mainPanel(         textOutput(ns("greeting"))       )     )   ) }  #' example server example_server <- function(id) {   moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {     greeting <- eventReactive(input$go, {       paste("Hello,", input$name %||% "friend", "ðŸ‘‹")     })     output$greeting <- renderText(greeting())     # (Optional) return reactive(s) for other modules to consume:     return(list(greeting = greeting))   }) }

title: Contributing to Odyssey
text: use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases welcome!

title: Contributing to Odyssey
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means â€™ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R file.

title: Contributing to Odyssey
text: want make bigger change [â€¦], â€™s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees â€™s needed. â€™ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to Odyssey
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please donâ€™t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation.

title: Contributing to Odyssey
text: Please note tidyverse project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.
